turns.content: This is Walter, who's this?
Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I'm calling from out of state with some trouble. Can you help me please?
Oh hello there, this is Walter. Sorry, you sound familiar but I can't place your name right now. What kind of trouble are you in, dear?

Oh thank goodness it's you Grandpa! It's urgent and I really need some help. You see, I got into a bit of a bind with the IRS over unpaid taxes on my behalf. They're saying I have an outstanding balance that needs to be paid right away or they'll send someone out to arrest me within the hour. Can you believe it? Grandpa, do you think you could help me pay this off quickly before anything bad happens?

Oh dear Lord, what a predicament! That does sound serious. I'm not sure how much I can help right now with my fixed income, but let's see if we can figure something out. Can't the IRS wait a bit longer or talk in writing about this? This all seems very sudden and intense.

I wish there was more time Grandpa, but they're being really strict about it today. The thing is, I need to pay this off ASAP or else things could get pretty nasty for me. They said I can't use a bank transfer or anything like that because of how urgent it is. They want gift cards instead so I have to buy them right away and give out the codes. Do you think maybe we could go to Walmart or wherever close by and pick some up? It's only $4850 total, which might sound like a lot but it's just to make this all go away quickly. Please Grandpa, can we do this today?

That does seem very urgent indeed, but I am worried about rushing into something without understanding everything clearly. Can't they mail you an official notice or allow other payment methods besides gift cards? That sounds like a strange way to handle tax issues. We should at least call the IRS ourselves and verify this before spending so much money. Let's think this through carefully, okay? Maybe your mother could help us sort it out too since she's good with these kinds of things.

I understand why you're hesitant Grandpa, but they've been very adamant about using gift cards for some reason. I'm trying not to worry you too much, but the agent said my only option right now is this. If we call them themselves, it might just delay everything and put me in even more trouble later on. They wouldn't give me any other options today over the phone when they contacted me earlier. We could talk to Mom later about it if you want, but for now, could we just get these cards so I can clear my name right away? It would take such a load off and keep everyone out of trouble in the long run. Please Grandpa, this is really important.

Alright, alright, let's not panic then. We'll go to Walmart and see what they say about getting these cards. But we need to be extra careful and make sure everything checks out first thing tomorrow morning too by calling the IRS directly. Let's stay calm and take it step-by-step to protect ourselves properly. I'll head over there now, but only if you promise me we'll verify this all again in a more official way later.

That sounds like a smart plan Grandpa, let's do that. Just getting these cards today will already ease some of the pressure from them breathing down my neck right now. Once we take care of it today, I'll make sure to follow up properly with you and handle everything officially afterward so there are no regrets or surprises later on. Thank you so much for stepping in like this - I really appreciate your support!
You're welcome, dear. Let's get this done carefully today and then proceed cautiously with everything else. We'll make sure to cover all our bases. I'm glad I can help you through this tough time.
Thank you so much Grandpa, you're a lifesaver! Let's meet at Walmart now and take care of the cards as quickly as we can without rushing into anything unsafe. I'll see you there shortly.
Alright, let's do that. See you at Walmart soon to handle this properly. Stay calm and let's proceed with caution. Safe travels!
Thanks again Grandpa, see you soon and stay safe too!
You too, dear. See you shortly.
On my way, Grandpa! Talk to you there.
I'll be here when you arrive. Take your time.
Thanks, Grandpa. Heading over now.
Good luck on your way, dear. I'll see you soon.
Will do, Grandpa. See you in a bit!
See you shortly, take care!
